executive_summary.project_objective: Develop predictive models for insurance risk analytics and premium optimization
key_achievements: Successfully built claim severity prediction models with 36.7% R² improvement
Developed claim probability models with 81.2% ROC-AUC performance
Created premium optimization framework with 67.3% accuracy
Identified key risk drivers for business decision-making

key_insights: Vehicle age is the strongest predictor across all models
Geographic location (Province) significantly impacts both claim probability and severity
Vehicle power and value are key drivers of claim costs
Safety features provide measurable risk reduction
Gender and marital status show statistical significance in claim patterns
recommendations: Implement age-based premium tiers with more granular adjustments
Introduce province-specific risk multipliers in pricing
Offer enhanced discounts for vehicles with comprehensive safety features
Develop specialized products for high-value vehicle segments
Consider demographic factors in risk assessment while ensuring regulatory compliance

implementation_roadmap.phase_1: Deploy claim probability model for risk assessment (Month 1-2)
implementation_roadmap.phase_2: Integrate claim severity model for reserving (Month 2-3)

risk_considerations: Regular model retraining required due to changing risk patterns
Data quality monitoring essential for model performance
Regulatory compliance review needed for demographic variables
Competition response may affect pricing model effectiveness
